item.title: Council malpractice and unchallenged incompetence, 29th December
item.description:
The council are actively refusing to empty public buns across Winchmore Hill. When I complain, my own bin is not emptied properly. I am fearful of active discrimination and the lack of scrutiny by a very well paid chief executive, The Christmas week has been sickening and no one has been employed to clean. The bin outside Grovelands park , one of the busiest parks of Enfield - and all of the parks bins - have remained filthy and overflowing, across the park and streets. The more I complain about this, the less they clean. We clean our own streets and I take the litter home from the church hill, hoppers road and park bins home, to put inside my own tiny bin. We have had no council tax reduction for this, The entire management system of Enfield council is broken . Allegedly hoppers road is cleaned each Monday - but this is a lie. I have invited the chief executive to meet me there on Monday to see the lies for himself, but he is still refusing. Criminal investigations and government scrutiny is needed as a matter of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Hill, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weekly street cleaning Missed on Sutherland Road, N9, 29th December
item.description:
Sutherland Road. Edmonton N9 both sides of this road has not been swept for weeks. The road looks quite awful and residents are complaining, its littered with empty plastic bottles, glass that has now damaged my car tyre and food etc.... also, the wet leaves have left large areas turning to mud with a nice mix of dog waste. Please can we get someone out from the council to investigate this. The schedule for weekly cleaning is Wednesday, Please can we get this reinstated to be cleaned. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Sutherland Road, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Business constantly using Woodland Grove bins to dump their end-of-day business rubbish, 29th December
item.description:
The restaurant (Angle Restaurant and Lounge on Trafalgar Road) is using the Woodland Grove flats communal bins to dump their rubbish at the end of each day as they don't have their own business bins arranged. This then becomes a massive dumping ground for other fly-tippers.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodland Grove, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chesterfield Grove (along the wall of Joe the Juice shop) 4th Complaint, 28th December
item.description:
This is the 4th complaint. Increase of flytipped items that has not been cleared. Extra black bags of rubbish and now a chair. It is a health and safety danger in encouraging vermin for residents including children, the elderly and the wider community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
